body.p: To His Excellency The Governor of Kentucky:
Your Petitioner, A. Mason, would respectfully represent that on the 9th November, 1860, he was fined $500, upon an indictment in the City Court of Louisville, for faro dealing.

He states that this is the first time he has been fined for such an offense; that he has paid the costs of the prosecution, including the part, $150, allowed by law to the Attorney for the Commonwealth, and he feels the penalty already paid is severe Enough; wherefore he humbly prays your Excellency to Excercise towards petitioner Your clemency and remit the balance of the fine, and, as in duty bound, he ever will &c

A Mason
Silas F Miller
R A Wimson
W S D Megonan S. J. C.
A B Carroll

Louisville City Ct
$500. } Faro
A, Mason
Issd Nov 16. 1860
